intro: Sebastiania lanceifolia, commonly known as the lanceleaf sebastiania, is a tropical shrub native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family, which includes many plants with milky sap. The plant is characterized by its lance-shaped leaves and small, clustered yellow flowers. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forest understories. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for ornamental gardening in warm climates.
